Source.Text:
Politics Drawn from the Very Words of Holy Scripture
In order to make this term [absolute] odious and insupportable, many [writers] pretend to confuse absolute government with arbitrary government. But nothing is more distinct, as we shall make clear when we speak of justice.”

question.qText: What is the main idea expressed in this excerpt from Bishop Bossuet's Politics Drawn from the Very Words of Holy Scripture?

aBtn.aText: Wielding arbitrary power is necessary for a king to be an effective ruler.
A balance of absolute and arbitrary power are necessary for a king to be an effective ruler.
Arbitrary power is granted to kings by God and is used for the good of the nation while absolute power serves the selfish interests of kings.
Absolute power is granted to kings by God and is used for the good of the nation while arbitrary power serves the selfish interests of kings.
Kings are considered to be sacred because they have arbitrary power.
